user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_poll_listen_socket:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
MHD_poll_listen_socket (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                        int may_block)
{
  struct pollfd p[2];
  int timeout;
  unsigned int poll_count;
  int poll_listen;
  int poll_itc_idx;
  MHD_socket ls;

  mhd_assert (MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_valid_ID_ (daemon->tid));
  mhd_assert (MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (daemon->tid));

  memset (&p,
          0,
          sizeof (p));
  poll_count = 0;
  poll_listen = -1;
  poll_itc_idx = -1;
  if ( (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET != (ls = daemon->listen_fd)) &&
       (! daemon->was_quiesced) )

  {
    p[poll_count].fd = ls;
    p[poll_count].events = POLLIN;
    p[poll_count].revents = 0;
    poll_listen = (int) poll_count;
    poll_count++;
  }
  if (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc))
  {
    p[poll_count].fd = MHD_itc_r_fd_ (daemon->itc);
    p[poll_count].events = POLLIN;
    p[poll_count].revents = 0;
    poll_itc_idx = (int) poll_count;
    poll_count++;
  }

  if (0 != (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    (void) resume_suspended_connections (daemon);

  if (MHD_NO == may_block)
    timeout = 0;
  else
    timeout = -1;
  if (0 == poll_count)
    return MHD_YES;
  if (MHD_sys_poll_ (p,
                     poll_count,
                     timeout) < 0)
  {
    const int err = MHD_socket_get_error_ ();

    if (MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_EINTR_ (err))
      return MHD_YES;
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("poll failed: %s\n"),
              MHD_socket_strerr_ (err));
#endif
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  if ( (0 <= poll_itc_idx) &&
       (0 != (p[poll_itc_idx].revents & POLLIN)) )
    MHD_itc_clear_ (daemon->itc);

  /* handle shutdown */
  if (daemon->shutdown)
    return MHD_NO;

  /* Process externally added connection if any */
  if (daemon->have_new)
    new_connections_list_process_ (daemon);

  if ( (0 <= poll_listen) &&
       (0 != (p[poll_listen].revents & POLLIN)) )
    (void) MHD_accept_connection (daemon);
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided function for uses of the C library function memcmp or any obvious wrapper around it. No occurrences of memcmp appear in this code. There are also no other standard-library string comparison calls (strcmp, strncmp) nor any code that treats character buffers as null-terminated strings and then compares them. The visible calls and macros (MHD_sys_poll_, MHD_itc_r_fd_, MHD_itc_clear_, MHD_accept_connection, MHD_socket_strerr_, resume_suspended_connections, new_connections_list_process_, MHD_socket_get_error_, MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_EINTR_, etc.) do not take const char* string pairs to compare and, by their names and arguments, are not string-comparison wrappers. The only string-related usage is a format string in a logging call; that does not involve memcmp. The memset present is used to zero the pollfd array (not a string compare). Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.
